lcn.p: There are three basic things one commits to when embarking on the Jedi path, which ultimately are one thing. These are Jedi Study, Jedi Life, and Jedi Perseverance. They are ultimately one thing because none of these three things can be sound without the other two.

The commitment to Jedi Study means that the Jedi commits to continually study the Jedi Code as well as the Jedi Arts. The study of the Jedi Arts is to especially include the Core Arts, which are key to the discernment of the Jedi Code, but also to include the Peripheral Arts that a Jedi is also obligated to study. Through the commitment to Jedi Study, the Jedi commits to study all these areas and to be guided appropriately by the metatemple, by zir instructors, by the respective Councils, by the metatemple's governing Rule, and by all other resources available, not the least of which is the Force itself.

Also through commitment to Jedi Study, the Jedi commits that in these areas of study, and any other areas that that Jedi might study, zie will approach things with the open-mindedness prescribed by the Jedi Code - that is, to not allow zir views to be dictated by inertia or by enthusiasm, but to properly scrutinize any evidence pertaining to any view, and to amend the the view if need-be.

extx.p: The commitment to Jedi Study requires a Jedi to study both the Core Arts and the Peripheral Arts. But it also needs to be said that the distinction between these two is not sudden and crisp, but a gradual continuum. Most, if not all Jedi Arts, will have some role in discernment of the Jedi Code - just some more centrally than others. It is all of the Jedi Arts that a Jedi is required to study as opportunity allows.
